fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27605]. {panel} I would like to be able to generate a task item for a list of groups or users from a single macro. For example, assigning a team-wide task: {grouptask:target=dev_team,qa_team,joe_user} Complete Confluence training by 12/21/2012 or it won't matter {grouptask} This would result in a list of identical tasks for each person in these groups: [] @dev1 Complete Confluence training by 12/21/2012 or it won't matter [] @dev2 Complete Confluence training by 12/21/2012 or it won't matter [] @qa1 ... [] @joe_user ... As of now, trying to create this macro, it seems that there is some magic to actually registering/creating the task that is integrated with the editor. I can visually create the task list but cannot get the tasks to actually register. A macro something like: ## @param Group:title=Group|type=string|required=true|desc=Select a group #set ( $groupObject = $userAccessor.getGroup($paramGroup) ) #set ( $memberList = $userAccessor.getMemberNamesAsList($groupObject) ) #foreach ($member in $memberList) ## This is where I make stuff up ... [] @$member $body #end However, I don't see how to: a) Use wiki markup in a user macro b) Find the proper documentation for API for [] c) Use the code generated by Confluence as an example, i.e, something like: ## @param Group:title=Group|type=string|required=true|desc=Select a group #set ( $groupObject = $userAccessor.getGroup($paramGroup) ) #set ( $memberList = $userAccessor.getMemberNamesAsList($groupObject) ) #set ( $tid = 501 ) #foreach ($member in $memberList)
  • $body $member
    • #set ( $tid = $tid + 1 )
#end The above generates the task items but also generates errors when trying to click on the task, I assume because the task wasn't properly created
fields.summary: Ability to generate task items from a user macro

h5. Steps to reproduce:

# Make a space or full site backup that doesn't include comments.
# Try to import that backup.

h5. Workaround
Delete all LikeEntity entries from the XML file - this will remove all Likes and will allow the import to continue.
# Open the zip file and edit entities.xml
# Search for LikeEntity. You will see <object> entries like this:
{code}
<object class="LikeEntity" package="com.atlassian.confluence.like">
<id name="id">1900546</id>
<property name="content" class="Comment" package="com.atlassian.confluence.pages">
<id name="id">1572927</id>
</property>
<property name="username">
<![CDATA[ admin ]]>
</property>
<property name="creationDate">2013-01-04 17:28:25.971</property>
</object>
{code}
# Remove the entire <object> entry, from the opening '<object class = ' up to and including hte '</object>' closing tag
# Repeat for all LikeEntity objects found
# Reimport the backup. 
# NB: You may need to clean the half-imported data out first. 
#- If it is a space, you can do this by removing the space and then re-importing. 
#- If it is a full site backup and you are restoring it as part of the installation, you would be better off cleaning the home directory and running the setup wizard again. Just stop Confluence, empty the contents of the home directory and restart Confluence. This will start the setup wizard again.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27596].
  {panel}

Currently, in order to create a Space Template, a user needs to a Space Administrator. I'd like to be able to allow users to create templates for their spaces without the other privileges that come with being an Admin.

I see 2 main options, either of which would be acceptable:
- Create a new permission, allowing users/groups to create Space Templates.
- Simply allowing any user with Add Page permissions to Create Templates as well. (you could make this configurable, to allow users to retain the current way as well)

I found issue CONF-3021, but it's 7+ years old.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence Users to Create Space Templates without Space Administrator Privileges

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27572].
  {panel}

I've seen two cases recently where customers have reported that searching Confluence from within JIRA gave them a "The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response" message instead of search results. Combing through JIRA's logs, it's reporting the following:

{code:none}
/rest/confluenceIssueLink/1/confluence/search [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service
java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to parse Confluence Remote API response
Caused by: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Character reference "&#7" is an invalid XML character.
{code}

I was able to narrow it down to a Word document somewhere that Confluence had indexed, and it was being returned to JIRA from the search results.

h4. Workaround
# Navigate to the *Manage add-ons* page
# Choose to display *All add-ons*
# Look for  *Office Connector Plugin*, and then disable the *Word Content Extractor* module
# Reindexing Confluence

This workaround would stop the functionality to index the Word document. Once your instance is upgraded to the Fixed Version (5.5.1), ensure that this module has been re-enabled.
fields.summary: Invalid XML characters in indexed Word documents cause Confluence to serve up invalid XML to JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27558].
  {panel}

Within Confluence, we would like to display a particular directory within a Fisheye Repository, and allow users to download those files by clicking on them in confluence.  The functionality we would like to see in a gadget, already exists in Fisheye.

Within Fisheye, pull down the Source menu and choose a repository.  Select the Files tab.  Browse to the desired directory.  Click on the desired file.

Within this requested Confluence Macro I would configure it to identify the repository, as well as browse to and select the desired sub folder (or perhaps even copy/paste it in from Fisheye).  That would become the "root" of the gadget (no browsing up, only from there down).  The confluence users would see that gadget on a page and be able to download those files.  The link for the file would simply contain the URL for the Fisheye server.

Ideally, this macro would also allow us to enable or disable search box, which would be restricted to this macros root path.

We would use this gadget/macro instead of attaching files directly to the Confluence page.
fields.summary: Macro to display Fisheye repo files within Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27557].
  {panel}

    See the attached picture of an important table we moved from TWiki to Confluence. The table is wide and long. While there *is* a horizontal scroll bar at the bottom of the table, because it is not visible while looking at the middle or top of the table it is *useless*. 
    Confluence NEEDS to put a horizontal scroll bar ON THE BROWSER, just like the vertical scroll on the browser. (There is a reason this table is as wide and long as it is, and our users want it that way. So that is NOT a workaround.)
    BTW, someone here said "just click on the table and use the arrow keys," but only the up/down ones work. Again, this is not a workaround.

h3. Workaround
Place the table in a 'column' macro inside a 'section' macro.
fields.summary: Need horizontal scroll on BROWSER; current end-of-table placement is no good

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27524].
  {panel}

At the moment, when the number of users with _can use_ permission in Confluence exceeds the user limit in the license, all users become read-only until the problem get fixed.

We could have a less disruptive approach to let licensed users work in Confluence. Two possible options are:
* Only new added users over the license limit are read-only.
* No users can be added (or received from an external user directory) over the license limit.

The sysadmins should receive a clear notification of this once they reach the user limit and even a warning if they are near to reach it (i.e.: 90% total user capacity).
fields.summary: Exceed user limit should not make all users read-only

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27513]. {panel} Importing XML site backup from a PostgreSQL-based Confluence to a MySQL-based Confluence fails due to size limit for DESCRIPTION column in AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION table (maximum size limit is 65535). The Notification table in Confluence contains a JIRA comment notification that exceeds the maximum size limit, which only occurs when users receive a notification on the comments on watched JIRA issues. *Steps to reproduce* # Set up JIRA 5.2 or above with Demo project and issues created # Set up Confluence behind PostgreSQL database # Ensure that the Application Links between JIRA and Confluence are established # Follow [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Workbox+Notifications] to configure Workbox Notifications. The following needs to be configured: #* In-App Applications #* Including notifications from JIRA # Create two users both in Confluence and JIRA (e.g. {{admin}} and {{test}}) # Login as {{admin}}, go to an issue in JIRA and watch the issue # Login as {{test}}: ## Go to the same issue in JIRA watched by {{admin}} ## Copy the whole content of [^99999characters.txt] file ## Paste this into a comment of the issue page # Ensure that the {{admin}} user receive the notification # Create a site XML backup for Confluence and then stop this instance # Set up a new Confluence instance behind *MySQL database* # Restore the XML backup The restore does not complete with the following error: !screenshot.jpg|width=500! The following appears in the log: {noformat}2012-12-11 20:13:15,751 ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.actions.ImportLongRunningTask] runInternal Failure during import -- referer: http://localhost:8050/conf/setup/setup-restore-start.action | url: /conf/setup/setup-restore.action | userName: anonymous | action: setup-restore com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with plugin Notifications and Tasks - Host Plugin(com.atlassian.mywork.mywork-confluence-host-plugin) #1.1.2: Could not import data in table 'AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION' column #6, value is too big for column which size limit is 65535, value is:

Maecenas nec odio et ante tincidunt tempus. Donec vitae sapien ut libero .........{noformat} *Workaround* # Backup the Confluence database (PostgreSQL) of the original instance # Identify the notifications that exceed the size limit in the Confluence database (PostgreSQL): {code:sql}select char_length ("DESCRIPTION"), "ID" from "AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION" where char_length ("DESCRIPTION") > 65535 order by 1 DESC;{code} # You can then run the SQL to update/clear these notifications: {code:sql}UPDATE "AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION" SET "DESCRIPTION" ='NULL' WHERE "ID" IN (select "ID" from "AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION" where char_length ("DESCRIPTION") > 65535);{code} # Export the XML site # Import it into MySQL-based Confluence instance h4. Possible cause The max length data types for "String (clob)" as per [this table|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/AO/AO+0.18.x+Upgrade+Guide#AO0.18.xUpgradeGuide-TypeChanges] don't hold the *same max length* across all the database types. In this case, for example: - MySQL's TEXT can hold up to 65535 characters/bytes ([reference|http://www.electrictoolbox.com/maximum-length-mysql-text-field-types/]) - PostgreSQL's TEXT can hold up to 1GB ([reference|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10395975/maximum-size-of-text-datatype-in-postgresql]), that is 1073741824 bytes/characters That explains, why TEXT-data-type columns in Postgres DB can hold bigger values which causes the data can't be imported to TEXT-data-type columns in MySQL. Perhaps we need to use different datatype in MySQL columns that could hold data up to 1GB, e.g. LONGTEXT?
fields.summary: Importing XML site backup fails due to size limit for DESCRIPTION column in AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27506].
  {panel}

Plain text searching for jira issues does not work

*Steps to reproduce*
# Install Confluence 5.0 OD 19
# Add 'http://jira.atlassian.com' as an application link (or any jira instance)
# Create a new page in Confluence, edit it and select 'insert'->'jira issue'
# Select 'search' in the issue browser wizard and enter any plain text for searching
# Receive the error 'recieved the following http error code from the server:0' (see attached 'jira issue error.jpg' for a screen shot)

*Workaround*
Use JQL to look for issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27498].
  {panel}

In the Space administration should be an option to set a default restriction for new pages.
e.g.:
Viewing restricted to: group "internal users"
Editing restricted to: group "internal users"

If a user adds an new page, this page should be restricted like configured (+ a view and edit permission for the creator).
This feature ensures that an article can't be viewed by everyone, unless it has been reviewed and approved for all space users.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27462].
  {panel}

When configuring the Confluence database in a new installation you see:
!url.png!

However, shouldn't _the above url_ be _the url below_?

This is something trivial but let us have in mind to rephrase at some point.
fields.summary: Minor wording change during Confluence db configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27460].
  {panel}

In the [Configuring Workbox Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF43/Configuring+Workbox+Notifications] page, it reads:

{quote}
To include notifications from JIRA:

# Connect JIRA and Confluence via application links: (Not applicable to Confluence OnDemand.)
* Choose Browse > Confluence Admin.
* Choose Application Links in the left-hand panel.
* Set up the link as described in Adding an Application Link.
* If your JIRA server is linked to more than one Confluence server, make sure that the primary link is the Confluence server that will display the in-app notifications in its workbox. See the JIRA guide to making an application link the primary link.
# Choose In-app Notifications in the left-hand panel of the Confluence administration console.
# Choose displays in-app notifications from other servers.
* Your JIRA server will appear in the list of linked applications below this option.
* People will see JIRA notifications in their workbox, as described in Managing Notifications in Confluence.
{quote}

Perhaps we should include that you need to set up the link so that the two applications _fully trust each other_ for the Workbox notifications to work.

If I am not missing something, should we perhaps edit our documentation to mention that?
fields.summary: JIRA should be a Trusted Application in order for JIRA notifications to show up in Confluence Workbox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27459].
  {panel}

h3.Problem
Currently there is no support for importing PowerPoint files into Confluence. There is only the possibility of using viewfile to view such files.

h3.Workaround
Copy and paste the content of the file into a Word Document. Import using Tools > Import Word.
fields.summary: Support ability of importing PowerPoint slides into Confluence, PPT and PPTX

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27458].
  {panel}

h3.Problem
Currently there is no support for importing Excel files into tables within Confluence. There is only the possibility of using viewfile to view such files.

h3.Workaround
Copy and paste the content of the file into a Word Document. Import using Tools > Import Word.
fields.summary: Support ability on Importing Excel spreadsheets into Confluence, XLS and XLSX

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27457].
  {panel}

Inserting a Balsamic mockup on a two column page layout with header/footer, inserts the mockup on top of the header, ignoring the page layout that was used to when initialising Balsamic.

To replicate, on the above page layout, insert on one of the body columns, go to 'create mockup', save mockup and close balsamic, gets redirected back to the page with the mock up inserted at the top of the page, on top of the header.

browser, Chrome 19/ Ubuntu 64bit.
env: https://confluence-ondemand-release-alone.jira-dev.com
version: Confluence 5.0-OD-8
fields.summary: balsamic mock is positioned incorrectly on a page template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27456].
  {panel}

As described at https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1998853215, dtaylor has added useful fields to the profile popovers.

Since we already have job title/department/location info in BambooHR, I'd love to automate a sync so that EAC is always up to date.

Please add an endpoint to an API for updating this data.

Something like a GET call which returns all the fields as a JSON mapping, and a PUT which accepts a mapping of fields to update (and leaves any fields not mentioned untouched) would be ideal.
fields.summary: Add an API endpoint for updating user profile fields
Prevent the need to do a full site index after every AOD space import
Add Insert Line Break to Confluence Editor Shortcuts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27446].
  {panel}

If a user is mentioned on their own page they will not receive a notification in their workbox that this has occurred.

To Replicate:

Admin makes a page with no content. User sees page and: 
# Edits the page, adding a mention of Admin.

The results of this:

Email Notifications:
# User edited the page
# User mentioned you

Workbox Notifications:
# None
fields.summary: Missing Mentions Notifications
Compare pages  from different spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27430].
  {panel}

Common Module Upgrade Pack 2012-07 is out: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Common+Module+Upgrade+Pack+-+2012-07

For Confluence 4.3.x, this means upgrades to:

    AMPS 3.11 (optional, possible compatibility issue with running OnDemand)
    Atlassian GzipFilter 1.11 (optional)
    Velocity htmlsafe 1.1.1 (optional, our current version of 1.1.beta2 is out of sync with the version bundled into template renderer 1.4.2)
fields.summary: Common Module Upgrade Pack 2012-07
Spaces Macro - Add ability to ignore archived spaces
Content by Label Macro - Add ability to ignore content from archived spaces
Provide a standard interface for all email notifications for plugin developers and customer customization (pluggable notifications)
